aws::graph::propositions: # Pilot Information and Flight Incident Details
The defining event was a collision during takeoff/land.
The aircraft experienced a nose over/nose down during takeoff.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot held a Flight instructor certificate.
The pilot was 28 years old.
The pilot was male.
The pilot held Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot held Multi-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot held an Instrument airplane rating.
No second pilot was present during the incident.
The pilot held Airplane single-engine instructor rating.
The pilot held Instrument airplane instructor rating.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 2 medical certification.
The pilot's medical certification had no waivers or limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on December 26, 2012.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on May 12, 2013.
The pilot had 1832 total flight hours across all aircraft.
The pilot had 50 total flight hours in this make and model of aircraft.
The pilot had 1776 Pilot In Command hours across all aircraft.
The pilot had 94 flight hours in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 25 flight hours in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 2 flight hours in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight

Takeoff | Collision during takeoff/land (Defining event)
--- | ---
Takeoff | Nose over/nose down

## Pilot Information

Certificate: | Commercial; Flight instructor
--- | ---
Age: | 28,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Right
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 
Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane
Second Pilot Present: | No
Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 2 Without waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | December 26, 2012
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | May 12, 2013
Flight Time: | 1832 hours (Total, all aircraft), 50 hours (Total, this make and model), 1776 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 94 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 25 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

---
